meanings.definition: A type of heavy jacket with a hood, often lined with fur or faux fur.
meanings.sent1: She wore her warm parka to stay cozy in the snow.
meanings.sent2: In winter, many people wear a parka to keep themselves warm.
meanings.sent3: The parka looked like a fluffy bear hugging her tightly.
meanings.sent4: Her parka was a shield against the biting cold wind.
meanings.sent5: The bright red parka stood out in the sea of black coats.

meanings.definition: To place or leave a vehicle in a designated area for a period of time.
meanings.sent1: He will parka his car in the garage overnight.
meanings.sent2: Remember to parka your bicycle in the bike rack.
meanings.sent3: She decided to parka her scooter under the shade of the tree.
meanings.sent4: The bus driver had to parka the bus carefully in the crowded lot.
meanings.sent5: They always parka their RV in the same spot by the lake.
